text: <a href="../1-Samuel-8-1/" title="1 Samuel 8:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-2/" title="1 Samuel 8:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: *they were* judges in Beersheba.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-3/" title="1 Samuel 8:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
<a href="../1-Samuel-8-4/" title="1 Samuel 8:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-5/" title="1 Samuel 8:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-6/" title="1 Samuel 8:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the LORD.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-7/" title="1 Samuel 8:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And the LORD said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-8/" title="1 Samuel 8:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-9/" title="1 Samuel 8:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.
<a href="../1-Samuel-8-10/" title="1 Samuel 8:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And Samuel told all the words of the LORD unto the people that asked of him a king.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-11/" title="1 Samuel 8:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint *them* for himself, for his chariots, and *to be* his horsemen; and *some* shall run before his chariots.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-12/" title="1 Samuel 8:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and *will set them* to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.
<a href="../1-Samuel-8-13/" title="1 Samuel 8:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And he will take your daughters *to be* confectionaries, and *to be* cooks, and *to be* bakers.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-14/" title="1 Samuel 8:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, *even* the best *of them*, and give *them* to his servants.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-15/" title="1 Samuel 8:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-16/" title="1 Samuel 8:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put *them* to his work.
<a href="../1-Samuel-8-17/" title="1 Samuel 8:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-18/" title="1 Samuel 8:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the LORD will not hear you in that day.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-19/" title="1 Samuel 8:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-20/" title="1 Samuel 8:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
<a href="../1-Samuel-8-21/" title="1 Samuel 8:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the LORD.

<a href="../1-Samuel-8-22/" title="1 Samuel 8:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 And the LORD said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
